7112,Berna Loraine,Maraming makaka-relate dito lalo na sa mga taga-upd.May nakasabay akong freshie sa Ikot jeep na bumaba sa may Shopping Center na may kasamang tatay siguro nya. At nagflashback ang aking 1st Ikot experience 14yrs na ang nakalilipas.Promdi ako noon kaya nagpasama ako sa tita ko na taga-Manila para sa PE ko sa Infirmary. Sumakay kami Ikot at umupo sa pinakadulo, likod mismo ng driver at sinabihan sya ibaba kami sa Infirmary para siguradong di kami lalagpas o maliligaw. Bitbit ko ang mapa ng UP at alistong nagmamasid sa paligid. Pagkaraan ng mga sampung humps sa kalsada, dumaan na ang jeep sa Infirmary kaya agad kaming pumara. Deadma lang si manong driver kaya nilaksan namin ni tita ang pagsigaw ng "para" (halos dumikit na bibig ni tita sa tenga ni manong) pero di pa rin sya tumitigil. Galit na si tita at para bang gusto na nyang tumalon sa jeep. Napasunod naman ako sa kanya kaya habang tumatabi pa ang jeep sa tapat ng SC ay nakababa na kami. Di ko na inisip o tiningnan ang mga reaksyon ng mga kasabay namin. Pero alam kong katawa-tawa kaming pareho ng tita ko.Di nagtagal at nakasanayan ko na ring sumakay ng jeep sa UP. Doon ko nalaman na may tamang babaan/ sakayan pala. Di pwdeng pumara lang kung saan-saan. Kahapon, nung pumara sina freshie at tatay nya sa may Infirmary, lumagpas din sila at doon ibinaba sa waiting shed ng SC. Naglakas-loob akong sabihin sa kanila na doon ang tamang babaan sa waiting shed at lakad lang sila konti pabalik.Napangiti na lang ako at nagbalik-tanaw sa mga unang sandali ko sa UP. :)

746,JeanHarry SanJose Condecido,Nung Sabado..kumuha ako ng talent test sa UPD.Di pa naman naguumpisa ay tinamaan agad ako ng malas. Sa dinami-dami ba naman kasi ng araw para makalimutan ang pencil case...bakit kelangan nung sabado pa? Buti na lang at naisilid ko sa bag ang coloring medium kaya may pag-asa pa. Naghanap na lang ng tindahan at nakabili ng mongol #1 at pantasa. Walang uni pins.. sharpie.. staedtler pencils.. hi-polymer eraser...mga matalik kong kaibigan.Pagdating sa UP..nung nabanggit na pagpasok ng kwarto ay humanap kami ng upuan kung saan anggulo namin nais iguhit ang isang estatwa...kulang na lang dugo ang ipawis ko. Balak ko na nga sanang umatras kaso mas malaking kahihiyan yun. Wala talaga sa forte ko ang realistic sketches at di ko inaasahan un. Wala akong kaalam-alam sa kung anong nangyayari sa talent test at wala akong kakilala na kumuha nun dati para man lang magka-ideya.Sinubukan ko pa rin. Nung una..mukhang walang patutunguhan pero pagkalipas ng ilang sandali..ay humahawig naman sa estatwa. Ngunit nang nasulyapan ko ang gawa ng katabi ko...balik sa pagiging basura ang pinaghirapan ko. Naging madumi ang gawa ko..effortless (hindi sa positibong paraan) at pang-amateur.Naaalala ko pa naman nung ininterview ako para sa application ko... ung mga salitang "sana makapasok ka dito..bagay na bagay ka dito". Yan ang nagbigay sa akin ng labis na pag-asa na kaya ko at magagawa ko. Kaso may kadugtong pa nga pla yan.."basta galingan mo sa talent test".At dahil dyan...alam kong hindi ngayon ang taon para sa "UP dream" ko.

886,Obet Conti Ramos,Here's the Prologue of the book I have written for this year's commercial release. This is taken from the original and unedited manuscript, written in 2013.Hope this would arouse the interest of many book lovers, especially those who had a taste of the interesting life in UP, either by spending years in studying or by simply jogging around its oval.Meet Andrei and allow him to walk you through the long but gratifying trail around the university oval. Get to know him, your past, and what both of you, together with the Oblation, have become.
130,Kaps Balajadia Violan,SUMMER QUOTESJust want to share some nuggets of wisdom collected throughout my summer classes. Some said by the professors, others by the materials we read.1. "People will remember not what you said, but how you made them feel."2. "Words donﾒt have meaning on its own. We give meaning to words."3. "The true measure of one;s worth depends not on a curriculum vitae nor the inheritance we leave, but the spirit we pass on to others."4. "Physical proximity (of people), without imagination, provides only a fiction of wholeness."5. "How can you own something that outlives you."6. "Do not quit, if you quit now, you will be used to it. Quitting now means quitting at more things in the future."7. "Consciousness is the antidote to alienation."8. "Lady Gaga was wrong. Nobody is born this way, society made you this way!"9. "The word ﾑbeautifulﾒ comes from the root words: be you."10. "Walang opinyong tama o mali, meron lang nakakatawa o hindi."

529,Jerome James Han,Oops.1st year college ako. Nasanay na ako na kapag papasok ako sa apartment-bedspace namin ay kada-bukas ko ng de-spring naming pinto ay papasok ako ng bahagya at aabangan ang pagbalik ng pinto. So hbang nakalikod ako, yung kamay ko ay nasa may likod ko waiting for the door.Then life went on like that. One day, pagbukas ko ng pinto ay definitely hinintay ko uli yung door. Aba, walang nadampi sa kamay ko. Katamaran kong humarap ay ginalaw-galaw ko ang kamay ko like I was waiting for the door (hey nasan na yung pinto???).Wala pa dn so naasar na ako at humarap.Gulat na lang ako sabay sorry kahit wala akong ksalanan.At nakatitig lang sa akin si Kuyang graduating.

After one year ko sa elbi.Nagkita kami ng blocmate ko sa may cr sa 2nd floor ng SU.Non-verbatimBlocmate: Ui, ikaw pala yan. Kamusta ka na?Ako: Eto okay lang. Naglalakad ako ngayon ng STFAP.(ayun chit chat ganyan)Then suddenly may lumabas na girl sa may isang cubicle..Blocmate: Ui, *insert girl name here*, si *name ko* pala. Blocmate ko.Girl: Ay talaga? Ay ate sorry kala ko kanina bago ako umihi, NF ka.Ako. O.o *di ko alam that time kung masaya ako o hindi*Then narealize ko yung suot ko. Galing ako ng byahe pero mukha lang akong high school na aattend lang ng practice.After a year ata, naikwento ko yang story na yan sa friend ko. At sabi nya:Friend: E pano kang di mapapagkamalang NF, e lagi kang may dalang malaking panaksak, kala mo lagi mare-rape ka.(tinutukoy pala nya yung sikat na payong na mukhang katana)Ako: WHUT! O.oDi ko na ginagamit yung payong na yon, pero wala pa atang taon sa UP na di ako napagkamalang NF. At ngayon, natutuwa na ako pag nangyayari yun. :)

(sabay tingin kay kuya)Kuya (tinuro ang isang aklat): Ayan oh "The Street Lawyer."Girl 1: Ayyyy, ayoko niyan. Alam mo naman, all lawyers are liars. (Sabay tumawa si girl at si kuya)Nang biglang may:"Excuse me, not all are liars." (ang tono ay tila bang offended)Meron palang isa pang girl naka-office get-up na nakaluhod at tumitingin din sa mga books ni kuya.Girl 1 (medyo natahimik) to Girl 2: Lawyer po ba kayo?Girl 2 (with pride): I am an assistant state prosecutor!Girl 1: Ganun ba? Ako rin! (Halakhak sabay alis)Iba na talaga na malapit sa Department of Justice ang UP campus.

558,Chad Roble,UPLB. 2013.Nagmamadali akong naglakad along Palm Drive ngunit kinailangang magbagal kasi sobrang daming students sa side walk. Sa harap ko ay may isang magbabarkada na nagbibiruan. Ang lalakas ng boses and ang lalakas ng tawa. I couldn't help but eavesdrop.Biglang merong isang nagbitaw ng korni na joke yung tipong "What if ipil-ipil leaf lang yung pang takip ni Oble sa penis niya no? Edi pati si little Oble, arms open wide and facing the sun din?"Walang tumawa. Pero ako - isang taong hindi nila kilala at nag-uusyoso lang - tumawa ng malakas.Bigla silang napatingin sa akin. Para hindi mapagbintangang chismoso, kinuha ko ang phone ko para kunwari may nabasa lang akong nakakatawang text.Deadbatt ang phone.Labas tuloy nito, hindi man ako tawaging chismoso, para naman akong baliw na tinatawanan ang patay kong celphone.

At dahil ilang oras pa ang palilipasin para sa next class namin, yung iba kong blockmates nagdecide na lang tumambay sa Robinson's Place Ermita. Ang hindi nila inaasahan, makikita nila dun si Sir na may kasamang boylet with matching hagikhik habang naglalakad. At bilang sutil itong si blockmate, inapproach niya si Sir sabay bati, "Hi, Sir!". Si Sir naman biglang na-tense, and just gave blockmate an awkward nod. Ayun, pagkuha namin ng classcard, puro kami uno. Ang tamis! Hahaha!

630,Regina Laciste,Isang Makabagbag Damdaming Pahayag mula sa nakatatandaHabang naghihintay sa pila sa UP-PGH, Isang matandang nakapila ang nakakwentuhan ko kung bat siya nakapila at magpapagamotMakalipas ang mahigit isang oras na pakikinig sa kwento kung bat siya naroon bigla siya ngsabi ng hinaing:(Non verbatim)Hija, buti kung makakausap kong mga kabataan tulad mo. Di tulad ng mga kabataan ngayon masyado mahirap na kausapin. Teknolohiya na e. Samantalang kami, mga napaglipasan na ng panahon.  Ang mga makabagong bagay di na namin kaya intindihin. Magpapaturo man kami sa mga anak namin. Nabubulyawan lang kami. Mabagal na kasi kaming umintindi. Pero nun sila ay maliliit pa, lahat ng karunungan sa mundo matiyaga ko binabahagi sa kanila itinuturo ko lahat ng alam ko at kung pwede lang dagdagan ang kaalaman ko para mabahagi sa kanila gagawin ko. Magpaturo man kami at hindi maintindihan wag naman nila sana kaming sigawan o bulyawan. Masakit sa loob namin. Sana kausapin na lang kami ng maayos. Dahil balang araw din naman mawawala na kami. Sana may nakuha tayong aral sa pahayag ni loloDi ko pala nasabi, siya daw ay nakapila sa pgh dahil may bukol sa kaniyang pisngi  n kailangan tanggalin dahil pag di nagtagal ay  maggng cancer n daw ito.

827,Sheena Kristine Cases,Life Lessons in UP:Isang araw, feeling ko kailangang kailangan ko na ng trabaho. Feeling gutom ako. May mabait na prof naman at binigyan ako ng raket.Nag-encode ko ng survey forms. Tungkol sa houses. Bawat isang survey form, nakasaad, may isang pamilya na naninirahan sa masikip na bahay AT nasa delikadong lugar pa. 4 square meters, 8 square meters, 10 square meters na bahay. 19 na questionnaires ang natapos ko sa araw na iyon. Kinagabihan, habang nakahiga ako sa kutson, masakit ang pakiramdam. Kahit kutson, masakit. Bakit hindi sasakit? May mali eh. Dapat lang na tumulo ang mga sipon at luha ko nang gabing iyon. Lessonz.

column3: CMO 20 is very controversial. Groups have claimed that it effectively removed Filipino from tertiary education
column4: however
column5: the truth is that colleges and universities can choose to use Filipino in teaching subjects. Because of this alleged removal
column6: groups have been pressuring CHED to require that 9 units of GE must be taught in Filipino.There is nothing wrong with teaching in Filipino
column7: but to require the use of one language in tertiary education is against academic freedom guaranteed under Section 5
column8: Article XIV of the Constitution. Even Mr. Isagani Cruz
column9: a Filipino language advocate
column10: recognizes this
column11: and has said:"" Academic freedom is generally understood as having the right to choosewho to teach (admissions and retention policies)
column12: what to teach(curriculum)
column13: and how to teach (methods of instruction). The freedomto decide how to teach includes the right to choose the language ofinstruction
column14: because the language of instruction is a major element oflesson planning and lesson delivery.""This is why I do not agree that HEIs should be forced to teach certainsubjects only in Filipino. That would go against the right to choosethe language of instruction.""We call upon students of the University of the Philippines
column15: a bastion of academic freedom to rally behind this freedom
column16: which is most precious to the development of the free mind
column17: by signing our petition against this blatant attack on academic freedom.

360,Ej Joves,Good day!Anyone who is willing to share their thoughts, opinions and ideas about the questions related to the number coding scheme here in the Philippines. Tagalog is acceptable.1.What are the effects of the number coding on the revenue of the bus companies?2.How can the government possibly DE-congest traffic condition in the metropolis without imposing more stringent measures like the coding scheme?3.Do you think a third world country like the Philippines can truly solve traffic congestion? 4. What are the effects of implementing number coding scheme?5. Do you think number coding scheme can help DE-congest vehicular volume in urban areas where majority of the population owns only one vehicle.Feel free to share your thoughts and comments about my post. This is a requirement in fulfilling my research in SS12-General Economics with Taxation and Entrepreneurship. Thank you so much!

109,Wilson Anthony Castro,Kanina pauwi galing UPM...LRT Scene (from Anonas to Katipunan)Katabi kong nakaupo si Ateng working na tsaka may nakatayong 2 UE Students sa harap namin. Pinag-uusapan nina UE students yung UAAP game ng UE vs FEU ("Battle of the Hepa Lane" daw). Sumingit sa usapan si Ate tapos nakita niya ang PolSci lanyard ko. Mukhang UAAP fan din si Ate since namention niya na hindi lang din basta-basta ang UP sa UAAP. Nung namention nila ang sayang na game ng UP vs ADMU nung Wednesday, biglang bumalik sakin ang agitating moment na yun. Yeah, parang block ko lang ang natatanging block na nagch'cheer sa UP esp on the last quarter (correct me if I'm wrong ah; wala kasing masyadong nagch'cheer sa UP side eh). Anyway, nangingiti na lang ako dahil ayokong magpa-FC effect. Gusto ko pa sanang sumali sa usapan kaya lang huminto na sa Katipunan station and uwing-uwi na ako -_-Basta. Sana ipagpatuloy ng UP ang recovering/improving/rising progress nila. Hahaha!!!U-NIBER-SIDAD NG PILIPINAS!!!

2810,Guien Garma,Mananawagan lang po sana ako.Kung may natagpuan/nahanap po kayong gray na WD external hard drive na naglalaman ng sandamakmak na academic at multimedia files, kung maaari po sana'y maibalik po ninyo iyun sa akin. It might have been lost within the vicinity of Vega Centre or Student Union Building. I can't emphasize enough kung gaano kaimportante ang laman ng hard drive na yun.May .txt file sa external na naglalaman ng aking contact details. O di kaya'y ibalik niyo na lang po siguro sa aming kolehiyo (College of Development Communication, sa tapat ng C-Park.)Let us make the Philippines better by making one simple act of honesty. Salamat!

308,Van Lyndel Sales Tolentino,c. 1 A.U. (After UP): The following was a non-verbatim, paraphrased conversation between me and one of my roommates in a room4rent apartment in Manila. He, by the way, graduated from U.C. (which is significant as you'll see in the way the conversation turned out):Kuya: Saang school ka nagaral?Me: UP po. Sa Baguio.Kuya: Baguio? Sa UC ako. UB? Di ba yun yung sa tabi ng SLU?Me: Di po UB. UP po.Kuya: Saan yon?Amused, I had to explain that there was a UP college in Baguio and that it was right beside SM (UC is at the other side of SM, which explains why the mentioning of school names was significant).c. 1 A.U. pa rin:I came to the apartment one day with girlfriend tagged along. Per landlady's rule, gf had to stay in the living room. This was how a conversation turned out as shared by the girl who'll probably whip my ass after reading this post:Kuya: Sa Baguio ka rin nagaral?My better half: Opo.Kuya: San dun?My better half ulit: UP po.Kuya: Di ba may scandal dun?My better half, amused: Ay, wala po ako naririnig.Kuya: Ay, dapat alam mo. Dun nga ako sa UC, dami kong naririnig tungkol sa UB e.My bett..err..half-annoyed girlfriend: Ay kuya, UP Baguio po.Kuya: Ah, magkaklase kayo ni Van?Disclaimer: Mabait po si Kuya. Vampire lang talaga dahil sa gabi siya normally normal. Wala pong basagan ng alma mater. Mahal po iyon. Thank yot.
3113,Kel De Leon,Subject: Eng 12 (World Literatures)TTh, 2:30-4PMRoom: 321Maaga akong pumunta sa AS for my Eng 12 class, around like 2:20PM. Hindi ko kabisado yung room number ng class ko. TINAMAD AKONG TINGNAN YUNG FORM 5 KO. Nasa kaibuturan pa kasi yun ng backpack ko. Yung another Eng class ko, Eng 11, sa room 325 naman. So may confusion. Napagbaliktad ko. Instead na sa 321 ako pumasok, sa 325 ako. Nakita ko yung classmate ko, siya una dumating eh. So pumasok na rin ako. (Pero wala pa rin akong malay na mali yung pinasukan kong room).2:30PM na. Nakakapagtaka, wala pang gaanong students sa room na yun. Suddenly, may mga babaeng pumasok, students din. HINDI KO SILA KILALA, I THOUGHT CLASSMATES KO DIN SILA.(Non-verbatim)Student: Lipat daw tayo sa CMC. Dun ang class natin. May event. *sabay alis ng room*Me to my classmate: (Nakakapagtaka naman, wala namang binabanggit na event si Ma'am last meeting eh). Saan daw tayo? Teka, may binanggit ba si Ma'am na event?Classmate: Ewan ko.Me: Eh ang alam ko may quiz tayo ngayon eh.Classmate: Meron ba?Me: Oo, meron. Sa Tartuffe.Classmate: Di ko alam eh. *sabay alis, sama kay student*Me: *sumama na rin*Nagmadali kaming lumabas ng building. Edi sumakay na kami ng jeep. Bumaba kami sa CMC. Hinanap namin yung auditorium. (Of course, kasama pa rin namin yung students na nagsabi na may event).So may event sa auditorium, yung book launching ng "Hay, Naku!". Nakalimutan ko yung author, basta lalaki yun. Natapos yung event ng around like 3:15PM.After the event, inassemble kami nung isang prof (babae to) sa labas ng auditorium. Non-verbatim:Prof: Next meeting, submit your 3 x 5 index card. Isulat nyo doon yung reaction nyo about sa event.Me to classmate: *whispers...* May kinalaman ba tong prof na to kay Ma'am *toot!*?Classmate: *medyo na-alarm* Hindi ko alam eh.After magsalita nung prof, nagtanong ako dun sa students na nagsabi sa amin tungkol sa event.Non-verbatim:Me: Ate, anong subject po to?Student: Eng 1.Me to classmate: Oww~ *snap* Damn.Classmate: <insert mura here>Me: *tumakbo agad paalis ng CMC* Balik tayo sa AS.Classmate: *sumunod sakin*Nag-abang kami ng jeep na may signboard na Katipunan. Merong dumadaan pero puno. 3:20PM na. Natataranta na ako (Ewan ko sa kasama ko kung natataranta siya). Aminado ako, panay mura ako sa sobrang inis na bakit ang engot-engot ko. Nung wala na talagang dumaraan na jeep. Napag-isipan naming tumakbo na lang pabalik sa AS kahit umuulan.3:30PM ang dating namin sa AS. Nakakahiya tuloy pumasok sa original room namin. Sumilip ako pero napansin na agad ng mga classmates ko na may super-duper latecomer. Tinanong ni Ma'am kung anong nangyari samin nung classmate ko. Nag-explain ako habang humihinga ng malalim sa sobrang pagod.Nung pagpasok namin ng room, swerte pa pala namin, magsisimula pa lang yung quiz. Yes, umabot kami. Pero hindi ko kinaya yung pagiging center of distraction kanina sa klase habang nag-eexplain ako ng misadventure namin.Akala ko magagalit si Ma'am. Akala ko di na kami papapasukin sa class kahit isang oras na kaming late. Akala ko di na kami makakapag-quiz. Pero baligtad yung mga nangyari. Buti na lang. Buti na lang talaga. Sulit naman kasi satisfied ako sa score ko sa quiz namin. :)Paalala ko lang sa lahat. Kung di kayo sigurado sa room na pinasukan niyo, tingnan niyo mga Form 5 nyo. Pag ginaya nyo ginawa ko, magagaya kayo sakin. That ends the story. Adios!~ :D :D :D

948,Jing Paz,Most women with foreign boyfriends here in the Philippines, I noticed, submit themselves to certain requisites: that they should be wearing skimpy outfits, that they should be covered in heavy make-ups, that they should be weak, simple-minded and predictable and that they should be passive and agreeable all the time.As if only by satisfying these requirements could they be loved ﾗ if love is what theyﾒre after.In an isawan a while ago, a couple arrived ﾗ a local and, based on his accent, I guess an American. She was wearing some leggings and rubber shoes; he was topless, sweaty and tattooed. Both of them looked sporty and the way they presented themselves suggests that theyﾒve been exercising. Jogging, in particular.Well, since Iﾒm addicted to people-watching I looked at the girl and studied her features. Hair in pigtails. Sando. Dangling earrings. Make-ups. I looked again. Danging earrings. Leaves hanging on the stem. Make-ups. Some bluish eye-shadows and linings.By the time I was engrossed wondering about the impossible relationship of her make-ups and jogging in this tropical environment, he left her in the clouds of smoke and went to the other side of the street. The task of waiting for their BBQ order fell unto her.To have a better view of them, I adjusted my position and went behind her. Her head kept moving, restlessly, following his trail as if heﾒd get lost though his movement was full of certainty.It went on like that ﾗ I, watching them; her, watching him ﾗ for some time, until the vendor handed her the BBQ. He came back, then they left together. Him in tattoo. Her in melting make-ups and eye-liners. Both of them quite young, early to mid twenties, and I wonder if they have sex.I wonder if after the present conditions and requisites have successfully commodified her, he would still take her entirely. Or if in the end, he would be like the other passing foreigners in this country ﾗ say, the GIs in Olongapo, Subic or Clark ﾗ snatching only the meaty portions of the market and forgetting the rest. Including their babies.Until now, actually, I am still wondering how we could arrive at this point when human lives are being reduced to products for sale ﾗ labour, women, even happiness and love. And when we would finally break these shelves and liberate ourselves from these shadows of conformity and expectations.

539,Dianne Nulada Reyes,Early this evening, may naholdap po sa jeep na sinakyan namin papuntang SM North galing UP Diliman.Nakahinto yung jeep along North Avenue tapat ng Veterans Memorial Hospital dahil sa traffic light. Habang masayang nagkukwentuhan ang karamihan sa pasahero, nagtetext yung isang girl. Bigla na lang may sumakay na dalawang lalaki. Yung isa tinutukan sya ng patalim habang kinuha nung isa yung cellphone ng babae. Dinemand pa at kinuha din yung wallet nya. Akala namin lahat ng pasahero hoholdapin. Kani-kanyang tago/kipkip ng bag at valuables. Sigurado kani-kanyang mental action plan din kung paano magrerespond pag sinunod sila nung mga holdaper. Pero bumaba rin agad ang mga lalaki at kaswal na tumawid ng kalsada.Wala kaming nagawa kundi iconsole si girl afterwards. Lahat po kami nashock. Si Manong Driver bumaba rin sandali at kinausap ang babae. Nung nagstop ulit malapit na sa Trinoma, bumaba ulit si Manong Driver at humingi ng tulong sa pulis na nagtatraffic. Pero walang ginawa yung pulis, sabi lang dun sa presinto magreklamo.Sana okay lang yung girl. Please wag nyong husgahan yung ibang pasahero. Nakakatakot kaya.One reminder for everyone: iwasan po gumamit ng cellphone sa area na iyon.

2312,Noel Orias,UPLB Awkward day Sumakay ako sa isang jeep, may nakasabay aqng mga dormates na di nmn masyadong familiar sakin (basta dormates sila tapos yung isa naka-cap). Pagdating namin dun bago sa may gate may napansin akong bumaba pero di q masyadong pinagtuunan ng pansin basta nakikinig lng aq ng music sa tab. Iilan n lng kami nanatira dun sa may jeep then lagpas na ng UP gate nang lumabas  yung last group ng up students sa tapat ng Mineski. (alam na)..........Yung last na lalaki na bumaba, (kasama sya sa last group) parang nag stomp sya ng malakas sa tapat ko (ewan ko kung dahil lng b sa paghinto ng jeep o sign lng yun ng pagpapaalam ng isang kakilala). Pinoprocess pa ng utak ko kung sya ba yung dorm mate ko na nakasuot rin ng cap at gusto nya lng mag sabi na mauuna na sya kaya:(Super bilis na ng mga pangyayarig to)me: "Uy" (parang gusto kong sabihin na sigeh una na kayo)yung lalake: "sorry sorry" (akala nya ata tinamaan aq ng paa nya)me: ay sorry sorry rin (ewan ko kung bat nagsorry rin ako)(tapos dahil nga naka-cap sya di maprocess ng utak ko kung dorm mate q b tlga sya o hinde basta alam ko bumaba na yung mga dorm mates ko eh. Tapos involuntarily: (pra magsabi ng bye sa isang kakilala) -_-(Slow motion naman dito)me: (nakatingin sa mata nya habang kumakaway) (yung tipong nakatulala)yung lalake: (kumaway rin sakin ng patulala habang nakatingin sa mata ko)(mga 3 seconds kaming nagkakawayan habang nakatulala) (siguro pinoprocess din ng utak nya kung kilala nya ba tlga ako)then....napayuko sya at tumawa ng mag isa. tapos narealize q na hindi ko pla tlga sya kakilala.

4712,Rich Recoter,An open letter to the UP Hooligans a.k.a. enemies of UPBy ANTONIO P. CONTRERAS September 24, 2014 Dear UP Hooligans, First of all, let me say that as a UP alumnus, and a former UPLB faculty member, I have every right to make as my business what happened on that fateful day when you shamed Butch Abad. News of your act has spread like wildfire in both social and traditional media. It has evoked a strong reaction to a point that even the President found time in his busy schedule while on official travel to condemn your act. He was so hurt by you disrespecting his alter ego that it rattled him more than the floods that hit many parts of the country due to Typhoon Mario and the monsoon rains it spawned. For some, your act was so abominable to a point that 23 members of the faculty of the School Economics of your University, my Alma Mater, rushed to defend Abad and condemn you in strong words, calling your acts as despicable forms of hooliganism, and virtually labeling you as dangerous enemies of your University. And as a University funded by peopleﾒs taxes, by implication you were condemned as enemies of the people. The letter they signed was unequivocal in its anger, and went to the extent of demanding that you be investigated, and punished. And your University President responded by calling for an investigation, even as in the same breath he condemned your act. Indeed, you have offended many people. It is obvious that you have rubbed people in power the wrong way.  As your fellow Iskolar ng Bayan, and as someone who devoted about two decades of my life serving UP as one of its faculty, I am upset. I am upset not at your act of defiance. What I am upset at is how some sectors of the University have betrayed you.   In calling you as enemies, they took the side of Abad. In declaring your act as pure hooliganism, they became instruments for a closure of the dynamics of resistance. They dared to condemn you for your lack of civility, even as they deployed apologetically the continued commitment of the University to be the harbinger of critical thinking. In doing so they converted what I thought was what made UP for what it is into an empty propaganda. In acting out your defiance at an official who is the face of the DAP that has been declared by the Supreme Court as unconstitutional, it now appears that some in UP are ready to desert you. In response to your expression of rage, something which in the history of UP is already a tradition, and about which it has so many stories to tell, and for which so many lives were lost as evidence of how far its children are willing to fight for what they believe as right and just, you have been bullied. You are being accused of being a bunch of hooligans by 23 faculty members of the influential UP School of Economics.   You are now being investigated by your University for being its enemies, for committing an act that is already prejudged as unbecoming of UP students. Your alleged lack of civility is now condemned by Malaca�ang. You are now being treated like a true enemy of the state in being assaulted in all frontsﾗfrom some in the faculty ranks to your administrators to the highest officials of the land. Senator Pia Cayetano, a member of the UP Board of Regents and also a UP alumna, has joined the fray and issued a statement in her FB page criticizing you. Even some of your fellow student leaders have now turned against you. I would not be surprised if the Church will one day jump into the bandwagon to condemn you. Those who criticize you believe that you have to be taught a lesson. But what lesson are they talking about? Is it a lesson in civility and self-restraint? Would it be a lesson that puts parameters on resistance, as if there should be a code of conduct on those who fight oppression and corruption?   I honestly believe that instead of being taught a lesson in civility and restraint, the lessons that UP should teach you are those that are long enshrined in the discourse that populates itﾗthe lesson of critique taking precedence over convenience, of the right to express being weighed in favor of the comfort of one who has power, and of the realization that civility towards rogues in power is a form of prior restraint. And these are lessons that those who now condemn you as hooligans appear to have forgotten. A hooligan refers to someone who does noisy and violent things as part of a group or a gang. In calling you as such, your accusers practically neutered the politics that you carry deep in your hearts.  You are not fastidious, irrational punks festering the streets and harassing old women and helpless girls and children. You are not bullies since you do not even have the power and the resources to make Butch Abad miserable all the time on a sustained basis. You are not simply a member of a raucous gang. They dare call you enemies of the University, and by implication, enemies of the people whose taxes finance its existence. This, just because you dared throw some crumpled paper on someone who ironically, and as validated no less than by the Supreme Court itself, was at the helm of how funds were sequestered illegally in violation of the Constitution. But what you did to Butch Abad was far less serious than the acts of academics who lend their expertise to provide legitimacy to such unconstitutional acts in the guise of practicing their professions.   It is indeed more damaging to constitutional order for people in academe to make light of, even justify, the violation of the Constitution. Did you call these people as enemies of the state for doing so? Well, maybe you should. Maybe, we should. It is blatantly hypocritical for academics to now deploy some rule in civility, and would argue as if there is a necessity for a handbook on how to engage people in government in moments of protest. Their criticism of what you have done to Butch Abad appeals to our moral sense as civilized, ethical people. Yet at the same time they are utterly silent on the sheer violation of decency when one uses public funds to favor preferred provinces, or uses peopleﾒs hard-earned money to bribe Representatives and Senators to oust a sitting Chief Justice.  They call your politics as misplaced, but are totally oblivious to the dangerous, if not unethical and immoral, politics that is engendered when one uses public funds to exact political vengeance on enemies, and to dispense political favor to allies. They call you hooligans, when the only damage you have done was to hurt the pride of Butch Abad. They dare label your acts as kin to gang violence when it is in the context of righteous anger, and not just unreasonable rage. They inflict in you the guilt of shaming UP just because you shamed Abad, and in doing so they have literally trivialized and devalued what UP stood for in all these years.   Well, my dear UP students, my only advice to you now is to keep the flame of rage and resistance burning in your hearts. Do not yield to the demands of your older generations for restraint. For in their youth, they have also done the same things that you do now.   And look at them. They are either collaborating with those who plunder our coffers and violate our Constitution, or becoming their instruments, or becoming their apologists.   It is most terribly unfair for our generation to inflict on you the restraint that in our own youth was not there and thus allowed us to test the limits and the possibilities of our collective efforts to challenge the powerful and the abusive.   Can you imagine what would happen if at this stage in your critical formation you are going to celebrate the need for a handbook or rule of engagement on how to conduct your protests?  That will be the end of days for activism, and will usher in the era of coopted pseudo-activism. It will become a field day for the institutionalization of consultations after the fact, or of staged protests, or of propaganda masquerading as seminar-fora, or of open forum but only with screened questions. It will be the days when student activism will become kin to company unions.  I urge you not to mind those who bully you and call you hooligans, or worse, treat you like enemies. Consider it as just part of the natural law of aging. As you grow old, you will realize that you become more conservative and intolerant of dissent. And as you acquire more power, you become more afraid of those who speak up. Do not betray the future generations by selling out to the conservative forces of the older generations, which unfortunately have infected even some of your cohorts. Be comforted by the thought that in the history of resistance, the many political rights that we enjoy right now are because of people who suffered even worse than the labeling and the condemnation that you now have reaped. The spaces that enable those who criticize you to articulate freely their condemnation of your acts are legacies they inherited from people who went beyond throwing crumpled paper at those who were from the establishment. And furthermore, be comforted by the fact that there are many voices in UP. You are being accused by those who claim to be ashamed of what you have done as not being representative of UP, but this is something that can also be said of those who criticize you. The UP School of Economics is not the totality of UP, as its Student Council does not represent the rest of the other College Student Councils. President Alfredo Pascual may be the UP President, but anyone who knows UP culture would not even dare refer to him as the bearer of a singular and undivided UP voice.   Be comforted by the fact that many of your faculty members do not agree with the 23 who condemned you. And be assured that I am not alone, and there are many UP alumni who are out there that would never abandon you, or betray you. So I implore you to please keep your resolve. And please be more understanding of those who now label you and call you names. It is your turn to understand our generation, and our political fears, even as you keep making us accountable for our political choices. Sincerely yours, A kindred spirit who has also been labeled as a hooligan in many instancesThe author is a former dean of De La Salle University.The views expressed in this article are those of the author and do not necessarily reflect the position of this website.

column3: SETTING THE DISCOURSE STRAIGHTOfficial Statement on the Sept. 17 Protest Action against DBM Sec. Butch Abad Corruption has no place in our bureaucracy
column4: and all its masterminds should be held accountable. This was our call when we mobilized last September 17 during UP Diliman University Student Councilﾒs Balitaktakan. It was a fitting venue
column5: because Dept. of Budget and Management Sec. Butch Abad
column6: the architect himself of the Disbursement Acceleration Program (DAP)
column7: came as one of the forumﾒs main speakers. Abad represents the ongoing greed and corruption in government. It would have been unforgivable to let him get away without showing the anger felt by each and every Filipino suffering every single day from dire poverty and oppression instigated by thieves like Abad and his boss Pres. Benigno ﾓNoynoyﾔ Aquino III. It is therefore necessary to protest; to register dissent against the wrongdoings of this state was urgent. It is already public knowledge that DAP is todayﾒs main means of stealing from public money. Still
column8: despite all exposed billions-worth of DAP that went to questionable lump-sum projects and the Supreme Court declaration of it being unconstitutional
column9: Aquino and Abad have consistently defended it as an efficient tool for government spending that brought their claimed economic boost. They say it was all done ﾓin good faith.ﾔ Yet all morality posed to justify DAP is far from the reality that happening. DAP
column10: as a form of pork barrel
column11: promotes patronage politics. It is much similar to the Priority Development Assistance Fund (PDAF)
column12: but with only the president having that sole discretion on where to allot savings and unprogrammed funds and released at the soonest possible time. This effectively gives Aquino the super power to control all government branches. For the record
column13: DAP subsidized mostly infrastructure projects by Aquinoﾒs allies in Liberal Party ﾖ which Abad is also a part of ﾖ and its led ruling coalition since 2011. Abadﾒs home province Batanes even received the largest allotment released from DAP
column14: according to a report by the Philippine Center for Investigative Journalism. However
column15: it still remains to be one of the poorest provinces in the country. And now
column16: they are legalizing DAP in the 2015 national budget by changing the definition of ﾓsavings.ﾔ This
column17: with the floating proposal of term extension and Charter Change
column18: are but systematic moves of the Aquino regime to remain in power. The current political crisis presents this seeming threat of another tyranny amidst the aggravating issue of corruption
column19: at a time when we are commemorating the 42nd anniversary of Martial Law. Civility and decorum at the height of social unrest and deprivation is consent to the existing status quo and a betrayal to the genuine essence of democracy
column20: a very valuable lesson from the dark days of Martial Law. Likewise
column21: to trivialize the protest as mere violence or aggression and to allege that its objective was to harm ﾖ these are but poor attempts of the state to sensationalize what happened and veer attention away from the actual and more important issue at hand. We challenge all those who have judged our behavior as unruly and barbaric ﾖ including fellow iskolar ng bayan and dear professors who have issued statements against us ﾖ to take a stand against the yellow dictatorship and corruption. The real hooligans with behavior more worthy of condemnation are out there in the government
column22: lambasting our rights and stealing our hard-earned money paid as tax for their own benefit. We believe that is what UP meant by ﾓhonor and excellence
column23: ﾔ true to the Oblationﾒs message and our responsibility of selfless service to the people. And might we remind all that even if UP is indeed a free and academic institution
column24: but it does not exist in a vacuum. Manners are not defined by intellectual arrogance
column25: but by history ﾖ when lives are at stake
column26: etiquette is biased to the ones struggling for our legitimate democratic rights and interests. In the end
column28: corruption and tyranny are all unconstitutional
column29: while how we exercise democracy ﾖ the protest we staged ﾖ is a constitutionally granted right and has its place in a society ill from crisis. UPHOLD FREEDOM TO EXPRESSION AND ASSEMBLY! NO TO CAMPUS REPRESSION!ABOLISH ALL FORMS OF PORK BARREL!NO TO YELLOW DICTATORSHIP!BUTCH ABAD AT NOYNOY AQUINO

8411,JV Sangalang,>The original post said, non-verbatim: "UP taught me equality. NU taught me what money can do." <Earlier, a lady posted something that was subsequently taken down for being rather offensive. I commented that she shouldn't, but ultimately, she did. I feel compelled to comment this, so to the lady who posted it, I sure do hope you read this. This was supposed to be my response but the post got deleted:While Ms. Abby's statement might be too sharp and unsportsmanlike, I hate how many of us ridicule people who voice out opinions in a blatantly honest manner. Perhaps, Ms. Abby's statement has too bitter a taste, however, we may not refute that it does reflect the sentiments of many people who do believe that UP's performance deserved to win for transcending the performance art that is cheer dancing. Some folks here who were critical of this post were equally as vulgar in their retorts. What does that say about Filipinos as a whole? In a singular, most accurate word from the otherwise ambiguous guts of the internet: Butthurt. A lot of us are butthurt.You can say that Ms. Abby's post is in itself butthurt, but if you do so disagree with it being so, why must you react in a similarly butthurt fashion? So, as I've said, please, do not delete this, miss

949,Jomar Fajardo Rabajante,Matapos ang laban ng mga unibersidad sa Pilipinas (pertaining to the cheerdance competition), laban naman sa international community ang tingnan natin (warning: this is not anymore about cheerdance).PERO kung ganito ang batayan ng laban, sasali ka pa kaya?From Times Higher Education World University Rankings:"Characteristics of the average top 200 university:1) Has a total annual income of $751,139 per academic (compared with $606,345 for a top 400 university)2) Has a student-to-staff ratio of 11.7:1 (compared with 12.5:1 for a top 400 university)3) Hires 20 per cent of its staff from abroad (compared with 18 per cent for a top 400 university)4) Has a total research income of $229,109 per academic (compared with $168,739 for a top 400 university)5) Publishes 43 per cent of all its research papers with at least one international co-author (compared with 42 per cent at a top 400 university)6) Has a student body made up of 19 per cent international students (compared with 16 per cent at a top 400 university)" Source: http://www.timeshighereducation.co.uk/world-university-rankings/news/the-formula-for-a-world-class-university-revealedAko? syempre dapat maging "world-class" ang UP pero mas bibigyan ko ng halaga ang "instruction" at "research" na may "social relevance". Hindi ito saktong masusukat ng anumang quantitative technique, ngunit mararamdaman ito ng sambayanan. Sa ganitong aspeto ba nasaan ang UP? Ang theme ng UP Pep Squad nung nakaraang laban ang nagpapaalala sa atin kung bakit inianak ng inang bayan si Oble (ito ang tingin ko sa huling formation ng Pep Squad --- may malaking oble na mukhang uterus at may maliit na oble sa ilalim). Ito ay hamon sa ating mga isko at iska, hindi lamang dapat sa salita dapat pati sa gawa... kilos na!

1312,Eric-John Soriano Calagui,1st Semester A.Y. 2002-2003, UP NCPAG, Diliman. Our college org (UP Pagdumala) conducted a symposium entitled ﾓYankees in Mindanao: Promoting Peace or Stoking the Fire?ﾔ A review of the ﾓBalikatanﾔ Exercises in Mindanao. Senator Juan Ponce Enrile, Congresswoman Imee Marcos and Sec. Roilo Golez, Guest Speakers. Lahat ng members ng org ay binigyan ng stickers o name badges para madaling iapproach ng participants kung may inquiries o requests. Napakaganda ng flow ng symposium. May mga participants from other colleges and universities. Malaliman ang talakayan ukol sa "pros" and "cons" ng "Balikatan" exercises.Matapos ang symposium, kumain kami kasama ang mga guests speakers. Masaya ang kwentuhan tungkol sa nangyayari sa senado at kamara at tungkol sa UP Days ng mga guests speakers namin. Picture-picture and after that, uwian na.Habang naglalakad ako from NCPAG papuntang SOLAIR/ ISSI para mag-abang ng Ikot, lahat ng kasalubong ko ay nakangiti sa akin, binabati ako at tinatawag sa aking "first name".: "Hi Eric, how are you?" . Yung ibang bumabati sa akin kakilala ko, yung iba hindi. Nakakaoverwhelm kasi kahit hindi ko kilala alam kung sino ako. Noong mga oras na iyon pakiwari ko ako na ang pinakasikat na estudyante sa buong campus.Pagsakay ko ng IKOT, may isang babae sa tapat ng kinauupuan ko na kinausap ako na parang matagal na niya akong kakilala: "Hi Eric, how is your day?". Naging skeptical ako, i do not know this girl. I just told myself, maybe we met somewhere. Bago ako bumaba sa sakayan papuntang katipunan, i said: "Sige mauna na ako". She replied: "Sige Eric, ingat." Wow, a stranger saying i have to take care.Medyo mahaba-haba ang pila ng dyip papuntang katipunan. So i decided na kumain ng fishballs muna. "Ano sa iyo Eric?", sabi ni manang fishball sa may Vinzons. "Manang kakilala niyo ako, ganoon na ba ako kasikat sa campus, para pati kayo kilala ako, what a miracle!?""Oo naman, eh paano  naman kita hindi makikilala eh may name tag kang nakadikit sa longsleeves mo. Unless, hindi ikaw iyan. So ilang fishball na nakuha mo ha, Eric?" Sikat daw oh! #kayanamanpala

2011,Sheldon Blanc,4PM. 2008. 2nd Sem. UPLB.After ng CWTS class ko from pahinungod, naglakad ako pauwi ng dorm. Ang pinaka malapit na daan patungong Raymundo Gate ay ang Never Ending Bridge  (NEB) sa likod ng lib. Hapon naman un, may araw pa, at may kasama ako. Wala akong dapat ikatakot.So habang naglalakad kami sa NEB, may narinig akong mga batang nag tatawanan sa ilalim ng bridge. Sumilip ako. Wala namang tao sa baba. And I don't think any children are allowed down there. Masiyado kasing masukal. Tinanong ko ang kasama ko kung may narinig siya. Wala naman daw. We kept on walking. Binalewala ko na lang ang mga bata. A few meters near the other side. Tumigil ang mga tawanan... Tapos may kumalabit sa binti ko. "Tara laro tayo!"Ang sabi ng itim na dibdib ng isang batang walang ulo.

3115,Jomar Fajardo Rabajante,Smart to install hotspots in UP campuses across Philippines"Philippines mobile operator Smart Communications has signed a Memorandum of Agreement with the University of the Philippines (UP). Smart will provide free connectivity and access points to all the constituent universities of the University of the Philippines System across the country. Under the terms of the agreement, websites whitelisted by Smart and UP can be accessed for free over WiFi inside UP campuses. Meanwhile, sites that are not whitelisted can still be accessed for free for 30 minutes per day. Data usage beyond that period will be charged the usual rates. Smart will deploy 120 hotspots initially in various UP campuses. It will also install 8 new base stations to add to the 6 that are already inside UP."

column5: was invited to attend the First UP Systemwide Student Congress. Three of us were delegates to the congress
column6: and it was held somewhere in Batangas
column7: for three days. I remember being disappointed because the keynote speaker - Raul Roco - did not make it. I also remember being so embarrassed that there were no delegates from the Diliman Kule.  It was a great congress
column8: although I don't know if we accomplished much
column9: but my story is about the third day of the congress
column10: right before we were to separate
column11: we had a get together sort of ice breaker something. And there was a feature where you can ""greet"" or write a short note for someone
column12: put it in a box near the emcees
column13: and they will read the notes that are placed here. There was a very pretty Gabriela who caught my eye
column14: and all I remember now is that her name is Tina. So I wrote a short note for her
column15: simply saying hello and that ""Tina-maan ako sa yo.""  But being the torpedo that I was
column16: I did not put my name on the note. I saw her smile when it was read
column17: but I never told her it was from me. After the Congress I never saw her again. The end.... ^_^

column3: Not overheard at UP but I think this is something worthy to post about:From a CNN reporter while reporting on Typhoon Hagupit (non-verbatim): ""To all those who are living in the coastal areas
column4: you better go to higher ground because of the 2-4 meter storm surges that are expected to happen in your area. If we get this forecast wrong
column5: blame us later. But right now
column6: everyone should go to safety.""Just goes to show that even those living outside the Philippines hope that all the forecasts about the strength and possible damage that the Typhoon Hagupit/Ruby may bring are all wrong and everyone on the typhoon's path may all be spared from this catastrophe! Let's continue to pray for everyone's safety!

column3: Hi fellow Iskos and Iskas! Baka gusto niyo bumili :)

# RURAL COMMUNITY CONTACT CENTRE - ALTERNATIVE BPO SOLUTIONLet me evangelize on this eventual scenario : the growth of the rural-community contact center with only a 20-seater team on every Filipino community - where internet is available - is inevitable.... this business model is real and we made it happen to simply prove a point : ""We can start this business without working capital.. and we did for five months...""Here are the reasons why this is the next growth area in the Philippines?- http://www.rappler.com/ﾅ/75679-free-public-wifi-philippinesﾅ- Web-based servers are cheaper than actual capital acquisition - Filipinos are good relational CSRs - actually world-class!- 60% of US businesses are SMEs and nobody is servicing their needs- Multi-national BPOs break-even cost is at least $5 compared to $2.50 - 20 man team is the best ratio for cost and bandwidth consumption- most internet cafe in the rural areas do not exceed 20 seats- It spreads the opportunities as well as risks- managing the center from start to finish is possible- creates a multiplier effect on trade and commerce- training and best-practices are passed on to the rural areas- De-centralization of operations equals to NO CARBON footprint- Gender empowerment is prevalent- more quality time with the family- At least an increase of 25% purchasing power for the agents- No start-up cost - low OPEX and higher SavingsTHE REAL QUESTION IS: Are there investors willing to take the risks???

column6:
Bwiset na 198 'to! Ang demanding!Grabe lang naman! Akala naman ni Ma'am, 198 lang subject natin! Hanep! !@#$%^&*("tapos antayan na lang ng grades. tapos na lahat. tambay tambay sa school, bonding bonding ganyan, tapos isang arawNapunta sa school, nakasalubong si Ma'am Gladys,Ma'am Maan (profs sa ibang subjects) at Ma'am Vicky(Prof ko sa SS198)Ako: Hi po! (ngiting wagas)Ma'am Gladys: Gagraduate ka na! (di ako sure kung tanung o informative)Ako: Gagraduate na po ba ako ma'am?Ma'am Maan at Ma'am Vicky: Gagraduate ka na nga! Sinasabi na nga eh! (sabay ngiti)Ako: (Sorry naman daw pero Ngiti na hindi maexplain. alam niyo na yun!)Silang tatlo: Gagraduate ka na! (Ngiti tapos palakpakan pa)...tapos biglang...Ma'am Vicky: Jerome, demanding daw ang 198 ah? (ngiti taas kilay)Ako: (tameme, napayuko at nagsosorry sa isip ko)Ma'am Vicky: You don't have to answer (sabay tawa)Ako: (ngiting kabado na nahihiya na lang sabay takbo sa malayong malayong lugar until the shame cloud clears. )hahahaha Dear Ma'am Vickie,hindi ko alam po kung kanino niyo nalaman yang post ko nuon kasi hindi ko naman kayo friend sa facebook, nevertheless, sorry po dun at maraming salamat sa demands na nagpadaloy sa Dugong Isko ko po at sa awkward moment na nagpatunay na walang forever, kung paano man nangyari yun. hahaha. :) deserve na deserve ko 'to!UP BAGUIOBA Social Science 08-*****

9710,Therese Pulanco,UPD, Kas1 timeLate nang pumasok na medyo sabaw pa ung katabi ko. [non-verbatim]Classmate: (natataranta) Nag-attendance na ba si ma'am? May quiz ba? Tinapos ko pa kasi ung term paper natin sa Main lib in 30 minutes. Di ko naman alam na ngayon na pala ung pasahan. Ako: Di ko din alam kung nag-attendance na eh, late din ako. Pero magsta-start pa lang ung quiz.Nagsimula nang magdistribute yung prof namin ng mga questionnaire per row. Linapag lang ng prof namin ung questionnaire sa ibabaw ng upuan niya. Classmate: (pinulot ung papel na nasa pinakataas at tinitigan lang)After ilang seconds na-realize ko na nakalimutan niyang kailangan pa niyang ipasa questionnaires naminAko: Ung totoo? Ganyan ka na ba kasabaw? Yan ba epekto ng hell week sayo? Ano na? Hindi mo na pinasa questionnaires namin? :))Classmate: Ay sorry!Tapos nagkulang kami ng dalawang questionnaires kaya binigyan pa kami ng prof namin kaso sobra ng isa ung nabigay niya. Ako: Uy! Sobra nabigay ni ma'am oh. Balik mo sa kanya.Classmate: Huh? Ano to? Test two ba to?Shemay, tawang-tawa talaga ako kaninang Kas1 habang sumasagot ng quiz. Saludo ako dun sa classmate ko. Sabaw overload. Pati term paper niya sa maling side niya na-stapler. :)) Ok lang yan. Kapit lang! Malapit nang matapos ang ating paghihirap. :))

670,Meryl Ancheta Bernardino,One hellweek,nagklase pa si maam, eh sabay sabay ang exams at requirements nun.. Ito ang   di ko makakalimutang moment sa HORT 209:Prof: What is internal breakdown?(Tingin ako sa classmates ko, walang nag eeye contact kay ma'am. 4 lang kami mag kaka classmates. Pagtingin ko kay ma'am.. Nakatingin siya sa akin... Tsk,.tsk..!)Prof: What is internal breakdown? (nakatingin sa akin)..Me: (Na tense ako, haha! Inalala ko binasa ko ng rush before magklase)Ma'am, it is a PSYCHOLOGICAL DISORDER in mango which is manifested by......(Napatigil ako kasi tumaas kilay ni prof...)Prof: Psychological?!!!Me: Ai sorry ma'am, PHYSIOLOGICAL pala!...Pagtingin ko sa other classmates ko, sabay sabay kaming tumawa ng malakas.. Hahaha! kaloka, pati mangga me psychological disorder na din. Naku, ako yata ang nagkainternal breakdown dun.. But at least, that's a good break! Ang tagal din namin naka recover sa klase kasi pag magkakatinginan kami ule, di namin mapigilan tumawa, kaso nakakahiya kay prof kaya nagsitigil din kami kakatawa :D#psychological#internal breakdown

3614,Kyle Cristian Segovia,(UPD) sinamahan ko yung cousin ko pumila ng pagkahabahaba sa mga subjects na kailangan nya. First time ko makapunta dun that time. Wala pa akong phone. Pero pinahiram nya ako ng Cherry mobile na ginagamit ng ate nya. Out of boredom, lumabas ako saglit para bumili ng food and drinks then balik sa pila. Habang kumakain I've tried na matignan kung may game, videos, songs or kahit anong pantanggal bagot pero w�la naman. Kinalikut ko lang yung phone. Napansin kong may antenna sya so naisip ko baka may TV sya at hindi ako nagkamali. So nanood ako, Bleach yung palabas. Speaker ang gamit, walang earphones ehh. Tapos napansin ko yung mga nasa pila, mostly girls nakatitig sa akin nang may "what the heck" look. And that was the most embarrassing moment ko talaga! Swear! Feeling ko ang weird nung ginawa ko! >.<Lesson learned: Pag na-bore sa pila, maghanap na lang ng pogi sa malapit. ;) ;)

4117,Denmar Provido,UPV City campus.Last exam ko na bago matapos ang sem. Nasa jeep na 'ko papuntang school nun at may kasabay ata ako na taga UP din. (Obviously, naka org shirt si ate na may tatak ng UP at meron pang 2 librong dala sa accounting 'ata yun) At dahil feeling major yung last exam ko na sa Hist1, nireview ko yung notes ko for the last time para sigurado. Nang malapit na yung jeep sa babaan, naghintay na lang ako dun kay ate iska na ipara yung jeep at 'di ako nagkamali. Sabi niya, "kuya, sa SPOTLIGHT lang po". Eh dapat sana stoplight, natawa na lang kami at pati din si Ateng Iska.So, yeah. Nawala focus ko sa aking exam dahil kay Ateng Iska. Kumukuha ako ng exam na natatawa, akala tuloy ni prof super easy yung exam na binigay niya at na special mention pa ako, kakahiya Salamat talaga ate, binago mo buhay ko. Idol na kita.  <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B2><U+0093>

column3: Maraming Salamat... LORAINE TABAYOYONG.Noong nakaraang taon
column4: Midterm noon sa UPOU Learning Center-Diliman
column5: paalis na ako ng may mamataan akong isang estudyanteng naka wheelchair at papasakay na ng kanyang sasakyan sa tulong ng dalawa pa nyang kasama. Halatang hirap ang estudyante sa kanyang kalagayan
column6: bukod pa dito ay kinakailangan syang buhatin upang maisakay sa kanilang sasakyan
column7: Napaisip ako bigla na bakit nya mas pinipiling magtungo sa Learning Center namin kung maaari naman siyang mag exam online
column8: Napag alaman kong halos 3 hours pala ang kanyang nilalakbay patungo sa learning center naming iyon para lang magtake ng exam at sa bukas ng kanyng mukha ay halata ang kanyang hirap na pinagdadaanan..Ito din ang unang beses na naranasan namin ang libreng mga ""CupCakes"" mula sa hindi nagpakilalang may mabuting puso na naglagay ng mga ito sa di kalayuan sa aming examination room. Ito din ang unang beses na nagpaskil si Loraine Tabayoyong ng larawan ng cupcakes na iyon dito din sa Overheard at kanya din itong nireport sa ""YouScoop"" ng GMA7 at naipalabas noong mga panahon na yon. .Kahapon lamang ay nakatanggap kami ng isang hindi inaasahang balita na pumanaw na si Loraine Tabayoyong at kasalukuyang nakalagak ang kanyang mga labi sa Philam sa may Las Pinas. Hindi ko siya lubos na kilala ngunit ramdam na ramdam ko ang pagiging mabuting tao ni Loraine
column9: Ang kanyang pagsusumikap para makatapos ng kanyang pag aaral at ang kanyang determinasyon sa kabila ng kanyang karamdaman. Larawan sya ng isang matapang na iskolar ng bayan na patuloy na lumaban sa kabila ng mga kakulangan. .At kay CupCakeBoy na palagi niyang pinasasalamatan
column10: alam naman naming nababasa mo ito. Pagpatuloy mo lang ang ginagawa mo. Alam naming napasaya mo si Loraine at madami ka pang mabibigyang ngiti sa kinabukasan. :-)Mula sa amin sa Open University

column3: What we must aspire to be:
My UP Acad Oval Horror Story. (SPG)Marami akong horror story sa UP pero this one really scared me. This is also one of those events that can culturally shock new comers.For some odd series of events
column4: I found myself late at night in front of Quezon Hall. Masyado nang madilim noon at medyo madalang na ang jeep na byaheng SM North. Ang tagal kong naghihintay sa waiting shed and I've heard stories of vampires haunting the night and shedding their rubbery skins for everyone to see in the lagoon at morning. The ambiance is getting more and more creepy as the sounds of carnal animals fill the air. The faint light of lamps beam through the trees like fingers projecting through the smog.Oh! I'm not alone. A man stands on the other side of the shed. I thought that was supposed to comfort me until I made sense of his silhouette facing straight at me. What's this guy's motive? Is he one of those psychos that jump on you while sleeping at bed?""P** kapag lumapit ka
column5: sasapakin kita!"" I silently said to myself. I'm torn between walking away
column6: running away
column7: keep waiting
column8: or close in on him.The guy walked towards me as I finally saw his friendly face smiling at me.""Saan ka?"" he asked.""SM North. Ikaw?"" I replied.""Over there
column9:
as he mildly pointed at a darker area in the park. He held a circle between his thumb and pointing finger, vigorously shook it, and slid his tongue on the inside of his cheeks."No!...No! No!" I said as my macho stance crumbled to dust without recovery.The jeep's timing could have been better but it's arrival made me so happy because I avoided the matters to get worst. I left hurriedly thinking that the nightmare's over that night. It's the end of that semester.A new semester is a new venue for learning and new people to meet. A familiar face came in from the door. He's our instructor. Oh sh**! The nightmare just began. Walang nakaalam sa mga classmates ko.PS: Napaisip din ako kung mukha ba akong call boy? This also not the first time someone approached me sa Acad Oval. Disclaimer: Wag kayong manghula ng tao because this happened a very long time ago and some essential details were changed. Gender differences also means nothing here. Hindi lang po babae ang nahaharass and everywhere is not always a good place to ask strangers. For an intellectual discourse, that's verbal vs non-verbal communication. Some actions are also subject to ethical issues. Also, bakit ba ang hilig ng tao sa tsismis?

Sa isang silid sa Ekon, isang maliit na grupo ng mga estudyanteng nag-aaral ng medyo mataas na antas ng Pranses ang nakapaligid sa isang mesa at pinagmamasdan ang patalastas ng isang tatak ng pabango sa isang magasin na ipinakita ng kanilang guro.  Nais ng kanilang Pranses na guro na sabihin nila ang kanilang mga nakikita/naiisip tungkol sa larawan.  (NV)Estudyante 1: Les bouteilles semblent des gouttes des larmes. [Ang mga botelya ay tila mga patak ng luha.]Gurong Pranses: Tres bien! [Mahusay!]  Estudyante 2: Monsieur, les bouteilles semblent des oignons. [Ginoo, ang mga botelya ay tila mga sibuyas.] Gurong Pranses (matagal-tagal na tinitigan ang larawan): Oui.... mais ce n'est pas poetique. [Tama... pero hindi iyan matulain.]Medyo napahiya si Estudyante 2, sabay kamot sa ulo at isip, "Ano ba ang mali sa mga sibuyas?"
4514,Sam Sanchez,We thank everyone who participated during the #IsangLibongAlumniParaKayOble! Quoting from the press statement posted in UP Mindanao Oblation Plaza Construction - Page, "To all who participated in the Oblation Plaza Construction, to the various alumni from the various constituent universities of UP who supported us in various ways (UP Manila, UP Diliman, UP Los Ba�os, UP Baguio, UP Cebu, UP Visayas, UP Open University, UP Mindanao, and the various extension campuses in Baler, Clark, Palo, and Koronadal), to the UP Mindanao administration, staff, faculty, students, and friends of UP, we say DAGHAN KAAYONG SALAMAT!  #IsangLibongPasasalamatParaKayOble!We have proven through our Oblation Plaza Construction project that we are all #1UP, even though we all come from the different units of UP. This project is the material representation of our values of Honor and Excellence, inculcated in the hallowed halls of our university, and that through this, we shall continue to serve the Filipino people through our various deeds and sacrifices, just as we did various tasks today, from carrying rocks and tiles, to having fun and blissful nostalgia with the company of familiar faces, to make this historical event successful.Mabuhay ang mga Pag-asa ng Bayan, mabuhay ang mga Iskolar ng Bayan! #IsangLibongAlumniParaKayOble! One UP!"Photo by yours truly. column6: anytime from 8AM to 5PM
column7: to help in the beautification of the UP Mindanao Oblation Plaza. The event
column8: titled ﾓIsang Libong Alumni Para Kay OBLEﾔ
column9: will use the bayanihan tradition to improve the Oblation Plaza. It will also serve as the culminating event of the 20th anniversary celebration. Alumni and their families and friends are invited to contribute ﾓsweat equityﾔ by putting stones in the inner circle of the Plaza in the morning
column10: help in the planting and landscaping in the afternoon
column11: and join the lighting of the Oblation statue by 6PM. Alumni with student numbers beginning with the year 1975 and lower are advised to wear red
column12: those with student numbers 1976-1986 will wear blue
column13: 1987-2000 will wear yellow
column14: and 2001 and up will wear green. Registration is free
column15: but membership to the UPAA-Davao will also be open. Alumni who wish to have their names immortalized in the Plaza may also place their orders for the Legacy Tiles to be placed on-site within the year. Booths
column16: food
column17: drinks
column18: souvenir shirts
column19: a trade zone
column20: live entertainment
column21: and a campus tour will be available for visitors. Emcees and students will guide participants through the dayﾒs activities. The UP Alumni Association Davao officers expressed their hopes that the goal of having 1
column22: 000 alumni in attendance will be realized
column23: in keeping with the spirit of ﾓOne UPﾔ as espoused by UP President Alfredo Pascual. UP Mindanao was created in 1995 through Republic Act 7889 as a result of efforts of the alumni in the region. Further inquiries on the event may be directed to the PRO at 0939-843-6634.""

7611,Rebecca Padua Hernandez,February 22, 2015Nasa SLEX Caltex station. After Winning The Inter - University Chemistry Quizcon. (YAY! CONGRATS ULIT! :3 ) Pinaguusapan namin ang symbol ng UPLB compared sa iba (primarily UPD And UPM.)NVKuya 1: Ito yung unique sa logo natinMe: anong meron po? Kuya 2: yung logo ng UP. Sa UPD at UPM walang banner.Me: weh. Sa UPM meron yan.Kuya 1: wala yan sa UPM.Kuya 3: iba rin yung symbol sa crest.Me: yun ba yung saturn in place of the cogwheel?Kuya 3: di rin yata.Kuya 4: di ba yung ibon parrot.Kuya 2: Eagle yan. Philippine eagle.Me. Di po. Bald eagle yan. Mga americano ang founders ng UP.Kuya 3: pwede naman yan palitan.(Ngayon naman sa banner beneath the UP logo.)Kuya 1: Anong halaman kaya ito? (pointing at the banner bearing the word Los Ba�os)Me: di ba laurel yan?Kuya 4: Hindi yan laurel. Mais yan. For agriculture.Me: di rin. Mahaba ang dahon ng Mais.Ate 1: sa tingin ko makahiya yan.Kuya 3: Hindi, fig leaf yan.Kuya 2: Hindi, push pin yan!LoL. What do you guys think? :)

570,Elmer Gwyn Bedos Capilitan,UPV-CM, 2010Pumunta ako ng Office of the College Secretary ng CM para mag-process ng document (nakalimutan ko na kung ano). Habang papalabas ng office ay panay kausap sa akin ni College Sec at dalawang prof. Syempre sagot din ako ng sagot. Paatras akong lumabas ng office at patalikod kong binuksan ang sliding glass door. Ngunit nagtaka ako bakit anlambot ng nakapa ko, parang hindi naman glass surface. Pinisil ko yung malambot na bagay ng hindi pa rin lumilingon. Malambot nga. Isa pang pisil. Napansin ko na parang natahimik si College Sec at dalawang prof.  Paglingon ko ay boobs na pala ni ate ang hawak-hawak ko. Dakmang-dakma!Walang kibo si ate. Bigla siyang ngumiti. Hawak ko pa rin yung Mt. Everest nya.  Me: Ay, sorry. Sorry! Ate: Ok lang.Nagtawanan silang lahat. Dumilim yung paningin ko sa hiya at di ko na namukhaan si ate. Bigla akong karipas ng takbo pababa ng building. Mula noon, medyo may trauma na akong pumasok dun. Buti mabait si ate at di sampal yung inabot ko.

Nag-uusap kami tungkol sa mga engkanto, kapre, tikbalang at iba pa nang biglang...Blocmate 1 : *tinuro ang punso sa gilid ng daan*B1: Alam niyo ba na kapag sinira niyo yan, mumultuhin kayo.Napatahimik at napaisip kami nung kabloc ko na isa at yung friend niya na kaclose na namin sabay tingin ka ing lahat kay blocmate 1.B1 : Diba yung sa mga pelikula, kapag sinira mo yan may mga multong lalabas. Ako: Sira, di multo yun. Nuno yun, hahaha. Nuno sa punso kaya ang tawag sa kanila. Tawanan kami ng mga kasama ko habang siya natahimik.B1: Ano yung nuno?Mas malala ang naging tawanan namin at inexplain namin sa kanya ngunit pinilit niya pa rin na multo ang tawag dun. Hahaha.

column11: just before the intersection. She had long black hair and was dressed in an all-white ensemble that I couldn't quite understand - white blouse and a white skirt at the UP Fair? And at that time of the day
column12: I'm pretty sure the only one walking from the campus dressed that nicely came from the concert.Anyway
column13: she looked pretty - she seemed petite with long
column14: almost sultry legs. Needless to say
column15: I was interested enough to try to catch up to her and maybe say hello. And that
column16: my friends
column17: is the Monster Energy Drink speaking.Now
column18: as a background
column19: I walk fast (15 minutes from the IB to the gate at central isn't that bad). But when my mom is flinging texts left and right
column20: I become a walking version of Usain Bolt. So
column21: I walked past the intersection; there's the gate!But
column22: wait
column23: where's that girl I wanted to check out?I stop. I look left and right. No one was walking at that area but me. And unless she walks twice as fast as I do
column24: I couldn't have missed her; it appeared as if
column25: as it seems the only logical reason at that time
column27: I missed out on an opportunity to meet someone.So
column30: and got home with aching feet and wallet.I sat down for a drink of water then realized that
column32: I had been eyeing a ghost.A ghost. So I guess

9415,Amil Asuncion,2 days ago, I rode a cab to QC. The driver seemed like a very religious man. He asked me if I was from UP and I said yes. He then told me, "Maam. Pagasa po kayo ng bayan (Maam. you are the hope of our country)." I just laughed back then because I was really tired, I didn't have enough sleep and I wasn't really in the mood to talk to people. It was only now that I actually pondered upon it. It was only now that I realized what I should have replied to him. I should have said,Kuya. Lahat tayo ay pagasa ng ating bayan.""

column3: UPLB2010NV2nd year si 'te' at first time na-encounter ang salitang prerog.Te: ano ba yung prerog?Batchmate: yun yung mag-tatalent show ka para makapasok ka sa klase. Grabe sa UP. Yung iba daw umaarte pa at sumasayaw. Sa harap pa ng buong klase! Ako kakanta nalang. Yun pinakamadali.Te: *thinks hardNext day... Mag-isa niya nagpunta sa office ng nasc9 prof. Bale 2 lang sila dun ni prof.Te: magpreprerog po.Mam: ok. Fill-outan mo muna to. *answers ringing phoneTe: *sobrang kinakabahan* *buti walang ibang tao! *gets phone and plays a song to sing along*Mam: *confused *stares at her while talking on the phoneTe: Saglit lang po mam. Wew. *pawis-pawis na *about to sing when..*Door opensStudent: mam
column4: aasikasuhin daw po yung blah blah blah...Mam: ok. Susunod ako.Mam: *looks back at te* *smiles as she realizes what's happening* Nakafill out ka na diba? Ok na. U can go.Te: yes mam. Tha.. Tha.. Thank you mam! *utal utal pa *realizes na ang prerog ay hindi automatically talent show *kumakabog ang dibdib sa hiya at tuwa na nagmamadaling umalis

5618,Joshua C. Agar,Para malinaw sa lahat.The place, officially known as UPAA Bowling and Billiards Hall and locally known as UP Alumni Center, was destroyed by a fire last midnight, June 30, 2015. The fire started around 11:40 pm, around the pit area of bowling lanes 1 and 2. The fire quickly consumed the bowling hall together with the billiard hall and the pinboys' quarters. By the time firefighters arrived, the fire was already inching towards the UP Alumni Canteen. Through  their efforts, the fire was put out before it reaches the Alumni Hostel.Thirteen employees of the UP Alumni Canteen and six workers from the bowling hall lost their workplace and therefore their jobs. Investigation is underway. There is still suspicion of foul play. Also, three organizations, UP Pool Club, UP Duckpin Bowlers Club and UP Student's Circle of Duckpin Bowlers(formerly UP Duckpin Bowlers Club - Youth), were displaced off their organizational hubs. All billiard tables and the bowling alley, which were there since 1972, were charred. Five PE 2 bowling classes were displaced. The proposed billiard classes for PE, which would convene of the first semester, would sure be cancelled.Let us pray for those affected. Sincerely,Joshua AgarPresident, UP Pool Club and UPDBC-YouthTournament Director, UP Duckpin Bowlers Club

6518,Carlo Miguel Bernal,Ok. So, meron akong nakausap na isang tao, not gonna say from what school sya, to prevent flaming. Ito ang opinion nya (not so verbatim): ."Naaasar ako everytime na nakakarinig ako na "taga UP yan eh. Magaling yan." Hindi magaling ang UP. Bakit? Kasi, unang una, ang mga nakakapasok dyan, mga top students from highschool. Hindi mga pipitsugin yang mga nakakapasok dyan. So, sa material palang, lamang na sila, compared to other schools. Pero, pagdating ng mga exams, mga BAR, board, etc., hindi naman yan nagtotop. So, ang labas, somehow parehas lang sa ibang school, like Ateneo, La Salle, Mapua, UE, etc. Ang nagdadala sa "magaling ang taga UP" is the talent and skill of the students who enrol at UP. UP did not make them "magaling." They were already magaling. Now, if UP really is THE prime university, dapat lahat ng graduates nyan eh maging superior sa graduates from other schools. Eh hindi naman ganon ang nangyayari eh. Had UP accepted mediocre students, mediocre as in "not from the honors class/honor roll", it would be just one of the other schools out there. Now, I believe that UP is just a name. Well, it helps in getting a job, because "UP yan eh". But when you think about it, there's nothing special about UP itself. Mga magagaling lang kasi ang nakakapasok dyan, kaya ganyan.".So... Anung masasabi nyo dito? What can you guys say about his opinion?.Edit: he's 60+ years old, and Magna sya from some other university. So, I thiiink hindi naman siguro sya bitter or something...Edit part 2: So nakausap ko sya ulit. Yung "top students from highschool" na sinasabi nya, not necessarily valedictorian, or may acad excellence award. He said he was referring to the "bright, gifted, skilled, or most hardworking students." If you were in the regular class and never got honors because you were lazy, at di mo lang ginagamit yung talents mo, kasama ka daw dun sa "top students" na nirerefer nya. And apparently naaasar daw sya sa mga nahire nya na mga taga-UP daw. Ang babaw daw magisip. .Edit part 3: Yung kinakaasaran nya na "taga UP yan eh, magaling yan", hindi naman daw nya biniblame ang UP. Kasi hindi naman daw yung taga UP yung nagsasabi nun eh. It's the non-UP people who say that. Now, (medyo verbatim) "hindi nila dapat igeneralize na just because nagaaral or nagtapos yan sa UP, magaling na yan. Because some are, others are not. Why is it that only UP is called magaling? Other schools also produce many excellent graduates. Why don't they get credit? Do you hear people say 'taga La Salle yan, kaya magaling yan'. Or 'taga ADMU yan, taga UST yan, magaling yan'? No. It's always UP". Hindi naman daw nya dinadown ang UP, pero he thinks that people look up to UP too much. He also thinks that the present UP people should live up to the people's expectations of them..Edit part 4: Forgot to mention na namention nya yung pamangkin ng asawa nya from UP Manila na doctor na ngayon (let's call him Doc), is one of those na kinakaasaran nya, coz every time daw na may itatanong sila kay Doc tungkol sa health, kailangan pa daw itanong ni Doc sa asawa nya nya doctor din. So, parang walang confidence daw. *Sana last edit na to*

9317,Wardy Puyod,One of the greatest traits I learned from UP is the "hanapan mo dapat yan ng paraan" mentality. While we may not have adequate facilities and learning materials, UP instilled in us the will and determination to get the job done no matter what and not to rely on what is around us but to think outside the box and go beyond our comfort zones. If you want to learn more, do not rely on what is in your books or what is in the library or the internet but rather look at what is happening in the real world and absorb it so you can understand not just how it works but how you can make a difference. :)While the truth is na tayong mga taga-UP ang pinakamagaling na reklamador sa buong Pilipinas, mas magaling rin naman tayong makahanap ng paraan at solusyon.Nevertheless, while it is a blessing in disguise that we learned how to be resourceful and developed a "thinking out of the box" mentality due to lack of facilities, we should still continue pushing for higher state subsidy and better facilities not just for UP but for the entire educational system.

9101,Karen Ann Macalalad,The entire bowling center and parts of UP Hostelﾒs canteen remain flooded after being razed by fire on June 30. According to UPAA Bowling Center Manager Elna Divino, the UP administration doesn't have any plans yet to rebuild the structure.Around 500 students from 12 duckpin bowling classes this semester were transferred to other Physical Education subjects such as cheerleading and weightlifting due to the lack of other bowling facilities in the university. Also, the UP Alumni Canteen resumed its operations at the Bahay ng Alumni since early July with the help of the other bowling center employees.Photo by Jiru Rada
1016,Enrique Frio,Dear UP Diliman,Ang sakit ng puso ko kapag nakakita ako ng posts ng mga estudyante ko (or kahit na sinong estudyante pa) na:"I love CRS ... post this ... do not ignore this ...""Sino po ang nagpapaprerog?""Please ... exchange slots tayo sa ...""Pipila ako ng 4 AM sa IB Rm 117 ... pwede kaya kay manong guard?""Oh no ... CRS, bakit nawala yung slots ko?""Graduating na ako, pero still waiting (on slots) ..."Wala po bang active investigations para sa solutions dito? Bakit laging short and mga teachers and classes? Ano po bang pwedeng gawin?Our students (and profs) deserve not just explanations, but practical ways to address this (implemented carefully and quickly!).[EDIT - added:] Please comment here (your experiences, hopes, and dreams) - may isang admin from the Office of the VP (branch?) who noticed this post in UPD profs to pick (and promised to raise this concern with UP admin). Maayos lang po sana and succint (straight to the point). Edit before posting, please!

column4: As far as I can remember
column5: you taught us to always remember and uphold 'Honor and Excellence' all the time.Now
column6: I'm wondering where they go when you ""under-assessed"" me for the past semesters amounting to Php 49
column7: 500 (exclusive of the Php 30kplus tuition that I have to pay for my last semester
column8: which is now) and stomped me of my democratic rights to impose that I should pay for your miscalculations
column9: which happened not only once
column10: but thrice and informed me only on the day of my enrollment
column11: which is supposed to be my last. Not only that
column12: you are preventing me to apply for tuition fee loans until you let me settle these nearly 50K plus. Further
column13: by branding me ""delinquent"" in my ever clean record since my first degree
column14: you are also making a lie and threat against me
column15: by preventing me to apply for higher studies abroad as you vowed not to release my TOR's and other docs should I wish to request in the future. How very nice and loving of you!I believe a mistake that happened once can be forgiven
column16: but thrice is mere stupidity
column17: and I am having a hard time forgiving you. You broke my heart and you are threatening to crush my dreams and my future for no fault of mine. Your schemes are so NOT HONORABLE and your system is so NOT excellent. But don't worry
column18: I will never be like you. I will stick to the first one - HONOR and EXCELLENCE.I believe I am only one of the many (but probably the only vocal - because of my incapacity to pay for your negligence) who were ""under-assessed"" for this semester. So my dear UP
column19: you miscalculated for everyone? Every sem? And you decided to collect all funds this year
column20: first semester? Did our corrupt government fail you again for disapproving the budget we need for this year that you just thought of something creative by milking the second degree students in the form of your ""new"" ST System? I thought you value research. Where have all your probing methods gone? Did you ever check that my parents are jobless and I am taking on numerous part-time jobs in order to pay for my own tuition while helping out in the family at the same time? I just wanna remind you
column21: you are training us to become intelligent and you are expecting us to be one!On the other hand
column22: thank you because you teach us that we should not and never tolerate wrong and fear NO ONE. You teach us to become critical and to fight for justice. Remember-- ""Matatapang
column23: matatalino

column4: 2015. 11:30 a.m. Ladies' CR
column5: 3rd Flr.
column6: Palma HallRight after my Anthro 225 Class
column7: dumerecho ako sa Comfort Room. Walang tao. Pumili pa ako ng maayos na cubicle. Jingle jingle. While I was entertained by reading random vandals/ hugot lines such as ""Mahal na mahal kita at ang sakit-sakit na"" sa wall ng cubicle door
column8: the shadow of the person using the next cubicle caught my attention. Ang likot likot nya. Tatanungin ko sana if may tao ba (kasi sure ako nung una na walang tao nung pumasok ako) or kung may problema ba siya. Medyo na-awkward na rin ako kaya binilisan ko na lang. Tumayo na ko to zip my pants. Medyo lumayo ng konti sa side kasi natakot ako baka hawakan ang paa ko or biglang sumilip yung tao sa kabila. Laking gulat ko na magiging totoo pala ang hinala ko! WTF (What the feels!) Sumilip sya (sa ilalim) at nageye-to-eye pa kami. Lalake. Maitim. Malaki at medyo mapula ang mata.  Sa sobrang pagkaloka ko
column9: sumigaw ako ng malakas pero dahil kami lang ata ang may class sa 3rd flr at medyo malayo yung classroom namin
