Tinanong ko sila if may nakita silang taong lumabas. Sabi nila wala naman daw. Nakakaloka talaga. Never na ako magcCR dun ulit.#PalmaHall #Creepy #GhostorMamboboso #MuntiknaAkongAtakihinTeh

1106,Pau Caparas,The Philippines is a vast and diverse ethnic country with about 14-17 million Indigenous Peoples (IPs) belonging to 110 ethno-linguistic groups. They are mainly concentrated in Northern Luzon (Cordillera Administrative Region, 33%) and Mindanao (61%), with some groups in the Visayas area. The Constitution mandates recognition, protection, promotion, and fulfillment of their rights. The Republic Act 8371 or ﾓIndigenous Peoples Rights Actﾔ (1997, IPRA) specifically recognizes right of IPs to manage their ancestral domains (United Nations Development Programme).IPs, however, generally live in geographically isolated areas with a lack of access to basic social services such as health care and education, and have few opportunities for political participation. IPs remain vulnerable to harassment and aggression as their naturally rich lands become subjected to commercial exploitation by private extractive industries. They assert for recognition of their collective rights to land, territories and resources; self determination; and human rights (International Work Group for Indigenous Affairs).Around 700 Lumad IPs in Mindanao traveled to Manila this November to bring light to issues of militarization and killings in their lands. They earlier held week-long camp-out in the University of the Philippines, before transferring to the Liwasang Bonifacio where they would stay until November 12.Photo credits: Katutubong Filipino Project#BreakFree#UniteAgainstImpunity

column6: unity
column7: and compassion of the Filipino people--ever ready to lend a helping hand to those that needs them.UP responded. The UPROTC and UP Vanguard through Oplan Mercy Trident

8820,Jay Lagrimas,Kakanuod ni Ate ng Horror Movie.Kakatapos ko lang mag-jogging sa UP cguro mga 5am ako natapos nun (umaga, pero madilim pa). Naglalakad na 'ko pauwi, dumaan ako sa dinadaan  ng TOKI pa C.P Garcia, as always madilim kahit may mga ilaw konti sa daan. Then nakita ko si Ate na naglalakad sa pathwalk, ang bagal maglakad, so uunahan ko na sana siya nang biglang nag-open yung Street light sa tapat ng Village A (Papatay-patay kasi). Eh di nag appeared bigla yung anino ko sa harapan niya, medyo may taas ako kaya nagulat si Ate. Napahawak siya sa dibdib niya at napahinto. Nagulat din ako kaya huminto ako.Inaantay ko siyang lumingon pero di niya ko nililingon nakatayo lang siya, kaya lumapit na ko sa kanya. Tatanungin ko sana kung okay lang siya kaso nagdadasal eh. Di ko talaga alam kung matatawa ako o hindi. Ang weird ng pangyayari na yon para sakin. Well, hinayaan ko na lang siyang mag-pray, umalis na ko. Nagmamadali rin kasi ako eh Share lang .. Di pa ko maka move-on eh.

column28: BABANGGAIN AKO NG TRAIN.  Dali dali kong pinihit ang susi ng sasakyan at maswerteng napastart ito sa unang pihit. Kumambyo ng paatras at buong diin na tumapak sa gas pedal... Hindi ko na inisip kung may maatrasan ako - nagautomatic ang self preservation instinct ko.  Maswerte rin naman at wala akong naatrasan.  Halos isang metro pa lang ang layo ng unahan ko sa riles ng biglang dumaan na sa harapan ko ang train.  Pagkalampas nito

4325,Kleng Arquiza,Mapagpalayang araw nais namin kayo na makasama sa #KontraRedTape: Kabataan Kaakibat sa Mahusay na PamamahalaMula Luzon hanggang Mindanao sali na sa:Logo making contestPoster making contestAVP contestAng Civil Service Commission, katuwang ang United Nations Development Programme (UNDP), ay magkakaroon ng Anti-Red Tape Act (ARTA) Caravan sa mga piling unibersidad sa Pilipinas.Ang tema ng ARTA Caravan 2016 ay #KontraRedTape: Kabataan, Kaakibat sa Mahusay na Pamamahala.Gaganapin ang #KontraRedTape sa:January 25- 27, 2016: UP Diliman Palma Hall LobbyFebruary 2, 2016: Leyte Normal University, Tacloban CityFebruary 9, 2016: Mindanao University of Science and TechnologyAng Objectives ng Caravan ay:- Increase public awareness about ARTAﾖthe law and the program- Increase public awareness about their rights and responsibilities as consumers of government service through the Citizenﾒs Charter- Increase public awareness about service innovations in government agenciesMakikita ang iba pang detalye ng #KontraRedTape sa CSC Website.http://web.csc.gov.ph/cscsite2/slider/970-arta-caravan

4724,Gino Estella,[CMCSC Statement on the UP Diliman Students' Magna Carta]We recognize the urgent need to pass the UP Diliman Studentsﾒ Magna Carta. However, even though it is a document that outlines the rights of students, we recognize that its provisions are not immune to the possibility of being interpreted in multiple ways. To enable us to better represent our constituents on the issue, we would like to ask the students of the UP College of Mass Communication to read the document critically and tell us through the form linked below whether or not they will vote for its ratification on January 12, 13 and 14, and why.View the Magna Carta: bit.ly/UPDMagnaCartaCMCSC minutes on the Magna Carta discussion: http://bit.ly/CMCSCMagnaCartaDiscussionTell us your thoughts: http://goo.gl/forms/d7BRCPLVIm

Cash is preferred, but food, clothing, and hygiene kits are also accepted. Thank you very much.#NonaPH #HelpNorthernSamar

2130,Rossana Ladaga Llenado,On the last days of our classes in UP,  one of our professors told us that what we studied in UP was useless.  We were shocked and couldn't believe that we wasted hours studying to no use. And then he said what we were taught was to be prepared for the future, for the unexpected, to be able to adapt well. At that time there were no cellphones and the internet. True enough, my training in UP helped me be where I am today.My experience as a working student also taught me the necessary time management skills that I use up to now. My years as a student leader prepared me to handle and manage people effectively. The long hours of work trained me to not only endure but enjoy what I do. In just a few months, my class, the Class of 1991 along with the Classes of 1976, 1966 and 1956 will be celebrating our respective jubilees.If youﾒre part of the celebrating classes, especially the Class of 1991 which I am responsible for, please mark your calendars and attend the 2016 UP General Alumni Homecoming entitled ﾓWalang Humpay Ang Tagumpay (ﾑNever-Ending Success and Achievementsﾒ)ﾔ on June 25, 2016, Saturday, 3:00 PM onwards at the Ang Bahay ng Alumni, UP Diliman Campus, Quezon City. The 2016 Jubilarians Sub-Committee will also be meeting at the UPAA Board Room, Bahay ng Alumni, UP Diliman on Thursdays at 2:00 P.M. of the following dates: March 10, April 14 and May 12, 2016. If youﾒre available, please kindly attend.For Class 1991, please, please coordinate with me. For other batches, please coordinate with the alumni office. Thank you!

1132,Nonilon V. Queano,HAPPY BIRTHDAY, NOBEL Nobel! Song 107. This is the birthday song I completed today beyond two other songs -- both on my musician son's birthday heheh -- which I kind of deferred, although, the last one, "Maligayang Kaarawan, Nobel, Musikerong Mahal" remains posted on YT. But completed this one today, finally, and did, as always, a quick, heartfelt recording of it which I would like to share here today. Today (in Manila)/Tomorrow (in New York) is Nobel's birthday. So this is my gift to my beloved son -- who lives and plays/teaches music in HK and in Manila -- on his birthday, this 2016. Hello, Nobel! Happy birthday! Love you. Tatay. :)https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QP3GXweamoA&feature=youtu.beHAPPY BIRTHDAY, NOBEL- Music and Lyrics: Nonilon V. Queano/6February2016/NYCHappy birthday, NobelKeep on shining, dearest childI wish you happiness, good things, and all sweet lightPlay the day or nightPlay on your guitarSpread cheer and light,Blessed is the heart that feels and glows for humankindSail on with your songs of lifeAh ha ah ha ah ha ah haIt has been a wondrous ride and ohHow you made all of us so proudYouﾒve gone around the world, seen placesAnd knows how life sometimes would not go rightSeen the world in strifeBut do play on, NobelHappy birthday, happy lifeWe all love you, and most of all your spirit and warm heartI do share your passion, child

6022,Roj Tirona,Jeepney Horror Story No. 2Naramdaman mo na ba na napaka-hopeless mo dahil hindi ka makapagbayad sa jeep. Hindi dahil wala kang perang pambayad, pero dahil yung pinakatatago mong isanlibong buo nalang yung natitira sa wallet mo. Huling pato na yan, game over kana. At kahit anong flip mo ay hindi magiging barya yang papel nayan. At kahit ilang beses mo pa ilabas pasok sa bag mo yang wallet mo at magpretend na magiging okay din ang lahat, matutulala ka nalang kung bakit nangyayari sayo ito. Halos gumuho yung bubong nung jeep sa bumbunan ko dahil hindi ko talaga alam yung gagawin ko. Lumingon ako kay Ate to the right hoping na may maipapalit sya sa 1000.Me: Miss, barya kaba? (Babanat sana ako pero naisip ko dyahe yun since nasa gipit akong sitwasyon ngayon) Me: Miss, may barya kaba sa 1000? (with matching beautiful eyes and bae smile na pang-Alden Richards) Ate: Naku, sorry wala e. (Sabay tingin sa cellphone nya na parang nililive tweet kung anong nangyayari sa akin) Kinausap ko na si Manong Drayber. Pero since nilalamon na ako ng kahihiyan, lumapit na ako sa harap kaysa naman iabot ko pa rin yung pera at sumigaw ng 'Manong! Bayad po! Isang Philcoa lang po yang isang libo!'.  Binulungan ko nalang sya kung may barya ba sya sa 1000, napakamot nalang siya batok niya at inulit kung may barya ako at tila hindi siya makapaniwala kung prank ba ang lahat. Sa Philcoa talaga ako bababa since kaya naman talagang lakarin yung flat ko from maskom. Pero nasa SM NORTH na ako ngayon. SM NORTH! Buti nalang. Buti nalang talaga may dalawang Engg' students kanina ( couple ata sila pero since hindi ako sure, hindi ko sila ioout). Sila yung nagbayad ng pamasahe ko from UP sabay sabing 'Taga-UP ka naman e and you look familiar'. Muntik na akong maiyak na parang si Aga Muhlach sa Basta't Kasama Kita nung sinabi nya yun. Inabot ni ate yung bayad kay manong with a smile. Seryoso feeling ko nun nagkaroon sila ng halo at parang biglang may flood lights sa likod nila. SAVIOR!!! Dasal lang, dasal lang talaga. Humirit ako para kunin yung pangalan nila, pero dahil hindi ko gaano narinig yung boses nila at kailangan na nila bumaba, hindi ko na natanong ulit. Thank you so much!! Grabe, sobrang nakatuwang isipin na andaming UP students na handang tumulong sa kapwa isko at iska during horror moments. And naku, dapat talaga may extra coins ka sa bag parati. So nasa SM North pa rin ako kumakain ng Chicken Shawarma dahil ginutom ako sa lahat ng nangyari at para mabaryahan narin 'tong 1000.

8225,Nonilon V. Queano,TUBAO. Song 107. 30Jan,2016. NYC. I don't know exactly why I would write a song with this content, but I had a melody and I needed to put some words to it.The subject matter/content is imagined, but not unreal. Not clear exactly what drove me to imagine the content but the only thing that happened today was my playing sarunay, agung, and dabakan, for a fund-raising event with Kinding Sindaw and other New York-based organizations at the Philippine Consulate here in NY for victims of Typhoon Nona (also known internationally as Melor).The other thing which gave me some excitement and pleasure was my meeting my former student in UP Diliman in the same event -- Irwin Lopez, now working with the U.N., who approached me and introduced himself as my former student in English 12 in 2007. I didn't recognize/remember him. He said that he had just finished his assignment in Paris and came over to New York for his U.N. job, just 3 days ago. It was good to have re-connected with him, especially, as he said he was going to come to KS Sunday workshops, as he is actually into music, too, and knows how to play guitar and percussion."Tubao" came to me right after coming home from our KS performance at the Philippine Center/Consulate. Wrote the lyrics and did a quick recording of it just now, so I won't forget. Here's sharing TUBAO. Thank you, All, for listening! :)https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ll_2D4Pxl20TUBAO- Music and Lyrics:  Nonilon V. 10024,Rebecca Padua Hernandez,UPLBPhysical Science Building"Small but Terrible" The tilas (higad or itchyworms a kind of caterpillar with hair irritants.) infestation is alarming. You could find them in tents, stairs classrooms and of course the hallways. Some students and faculty shriek at the site of them and their abundance that they opted to cover their heads and run. Janitors are trying their best to sweep them away but they always come back (di kagaya ng minamahal mo. Charot) Magingat po at wagmagpanic kung may napadpad na tilas sa iyong bag o damit. :-)

3131,TJ Capulong,THE RADICAL DEVIATION: REVOLUTIONIt is of high time indeed that the Iskolars ng Bayan, the largest stakeholders of this institution, must firmly stand and collectively wage a revolution to destroy these atrocities. And so, this March 11, in line with the celebration of Deviance Day 2016 dubbed Rebolusyon, Anakbayan, in alliance with Alyansa ng mga Aktibong Kabataan ng UP Mindanao (ANAK UPMin), calls for every Iskolar ng Bayan to defy the norms and stand subversive to the oppressive state of education.We urge the UP Mindanao community to take part in the National Day of Action and walkout against this colonial, commercialized and repressive education system. We thrust with our calls:Junk the socialized tuition scheme!Scrap other school fees!Oppose profit-oriented and anti-student GE reforms!Demand for greater state subsidy!Justice for the victims of state abandonment!Fight against a colonial, commercialized, repressive education!Onwards to a nationalist, scientific, mass-oriented education!#Rebolusyon #AyokongMagmahal

Apo bush fire and #bigashindibala campaign) na mga internally displaced LUMAD brothers and sisters natin na patuloy na naghihirap dito sa Davao City. Ang patuloy militarisasyon sa kanilang mga pinanggalingang mga lugar dito sa Mindanao ay nagtulak sa kanila na lumikas at walang siguradong pagkakakitaan at walang lupang sinasakahan upang ipanlalaman ng kanilang mga tiyan. Their fight for life is still strong but they are slowly weakened with their growing number at their mere camp. May mga isyu ngayon

column3:
Were you there when the fire burned the building down? Why are you so emotional then?"I was there. The work I have done as a student was there, the papers we had worked on.. the papers/thesis/projects us iskos/iskas (past/present) have worked on. The sleepless nights we all spent working on the tasks our profs gave. The very same profs that we may have hated, liked, loved, or even been terrified of. The memories we have gathered from the many days/months/years we spent walking along its corridors, lining up for classes, knocking door-to-door begging for slots, and staying there just for the sake of it. I was there... no, the whole of UP was there.

column3: PAKIPASA PAGKA-B�SA. #Eleksyon2016 #HuwadNaDaan ""...Inequality is real - and it is worsening.These are the people who cannot wait for the supposed economic gains to trickle down. These are the people who
column4: despite all their efforts
column5: cannot get ahead. The opportunities of the wealthy are vastly different from the ""opportunities"" of the poor. Who are you to tell them what they need? Who are you to tell them what is good for them? You who have never felt poverty
column6: you who have never felt the crippling fear of uncertainty. Poverty is something you've read about in books and journals - not something you've lived
column7: not something that you've survived. Who are you to tell them to wait for growth to trickle down? They are struggling NOW. They are starving NOW. They are suffering NOW. And you ask them to wait. Unlike you they do not have the luxury to wait. Unlike you they were not winners in the lottery of life.You tell them to work hard. You tell them to work harder. The opportunities will come. You don't realize that they already work harder than you. They work longer hours for smaller pay and yet you tell them that they will succeed through hard work and perseverance. You insult them with your platitudes. You insult them with your painfully condescending platitudes. And you wonder why they cannot accept your candidate. And you wonder why they cannot accept Daang Matuwid. And you wonder why they are hungry
column8: starving
column9: desperate for change.""Paki-tag sina Fudolig and Celdran.

UP Vargas Museum joins the world in celebrating 2016 International Museum Day by holding a nine-day museum training for children. This year
column4: JMG highlights the museum as a place of interaction among many kinds of cultures and peoples. The theme for 2016 as set by the International Council of Museums (ICOM) is ""Museum and Cultural Landscapes.""The workshop will be held for two weeks from Tuesday to Saturday
column5: 1 to 5 pm. The lessons that the junior museum guides will learn are basic museum practices: docenting inside galleries
column6: documenting and handling of museum objects
column7: and planning of an exhibition. Hands-on art activities for this year are the following: Drawing and Comics-Making by Manix Abrera
column8: Printmaking by Angelo Magno and Mars Bugaoan and Paper Art by Dexter Sy and LJ Ablola. A graduation cum exhibition opening will culminate the JMG activities on the tenth day. The 11th edition of JMG is supported by Friuli Trattoria.

column3: The stupidity of the Multi Party System: even if 70 percent of the people don't like you you can still win if there are 5 people vying for the same position. This is because it is a winner take all system. You end up with poor quality leaders. These leaders will most likely be destined for jail terms after their term in office. With 70% of the people acting as opposition
